definition: to serve in the army/to be a soldier
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: After graduation from high school they went soldiering.
sentences.chinese: 中学毕业后他们去当兵。

sentences.english: The languages I learned in the Army came in handy.
sentences.chinese: 我在部队当兵时学到的语言派上了用场。

sentences.english: However, many Swiss committee suicide by using such guns;
sentences.chinese: 不过，很多瑞士人就用当兵时公家发的枪枝自杀。

sentences.english: My older brother was always gone. He is served in the army for 31 years.
sentences.chinese: 我大哥总是不在家，因为他当兵，一当就是31年。

sentences.english: REJECT】He tried to join the army but was rejected because of his poor health.
sentences.chinese: 他想当兵，可是因健康不好而被拒绝。

sentences.english: And supposedly, some men went out for the army, signed on.
sentences.chinese: 据说，有人出去当兵，签了生死书。

sentences.english: This was the battle theater in which my father had served.
sentences.chinese: 这里是我父亲当兵时曾经到过的战场。

sentences.english: He hopes to go soldiering after his college graduation.
sentences.chinese: 他希望大学毕业后去当兵。

sentences.english: Sometimes soldiers can be so unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 当兵的有时候就是这么不讲道理。

sentences.english: Xian-min liu learned that after the arrangement of his father, he dont want to go to a soldier.
sentences.chinese: 刘宪民得知他爸的安排后十分恼火，他不想去当兵。

sentences.english: I shall go and enlist for a soldier , and never see my dear Toad Hall any more!
sentences.chinese: 我要报名当兵去，永不再见我亲爱的蟾宫了。

sentences.english: The older students fell out quietly and drifted away to enlistments.
sentences.chinese: 年纪大点的学生先后悄悄地退学，入伍当兵去了。

sentences.english: The prince is going to a soldier, dont give up his childhood sweetheart lover core.
sentences.chinese: 王子尚要去当兵，不舍他的青梅竹马的恋人子芯。

sentences.english: Who serves as a soldier at his own expense?
Although we got married when I was a private I had confidence about the future.
sentences.chinese: 虽然当我们结婚时我仍在当兵但对于未来我有信心。

sentences.english: His regular engagement ends soon, but he's thinking of soldiering on.
sentences.chinese: 他的定期兵役就要结束了，但他还想继续当兵。

definition: to be discharged from military service
to enlist/to serve in the army
to join up/to enlist (e.g. in the military)
to rise through the ranks (as a party cadre)
to change one's profession/to transfer to civilian work
guard home, defend the country (idiom); national defense
